Hi,

I would like to apologize for my last post - strays way to far into tl=
;dr territory and I am way too excited, obviously.

What I would like to di=
scuss is this:

Given the fact that XML is *not* a hypermedia format, and a=
lso given the fact that being a hypermedia format akin to HTML is its numbe=
r one goal,

a) Why is it not a hypermedia format?
b) What would the benefi=
ts be if XML *was* a hypermedia format and?
c) What ways could that be achi=
eved?

There must be a couple of ways.  XLink seems to have been the first =
attempt. Atom took another approach (why?), which works well, and seems to =
have even some traction outside of Atom.  HAL seems to take another approac=
h.

Staying above the fold from here on in :-)
Cheers,
Peter
